comment: Dr. Gulley is an amazing quantum physics educator. His through understanding of QM shows in every lecture, making complex concepts accessible and engaging for novices. Furthermore, his prioritization of student success is commendable. Truly a standout professor.
Gulley was a great professor.  His instructions were always clear and he helped us whenever we got stuck.  I learned more here than in my lecture.
He will help students to solve difficulties.

Dr. Gulley is very knowledgable. He explains concepts super well and is always willing to help. He'll meet with you any day of the week if you need help. There were 4 exams and a final, hw every week, and 8 breakout sessions counted for a grade. The tests were very hard but he offered partial credit where he could. He also gave a formula sheet.
Easy to get A

I took AP Physics in high school and barely managed to get a C in that class. I learned nothing by the end of that class. It's been a semester since I've taken physics with Dr. Gulley and still remember what he taught me. It's a shame most teachers don't teach like this guy. He is clear, concise, and remarkably skilled at lecturing.

Prof. Gulley is outstanding. Physics 1 Lab is graded only on lab sheets, with 1 available drop. Prof. Gulley answers every question and makes sure you understand the lab. He is an excellent lab professor and I would suggest him to anyone without fail. TAKE HIM FOR LAB OR YOU WILL BE MAKING A MISTAKE
rating_tags: Group projects--Clear grading criteria--Accessible outside class

comment: Taking him for Physic Lab 1, he's really fun and the way he explains the problems are really attractable. If you need any help in the lab he probably will explain for you again and maybe help you finish the lab as well! would definitely taking him again for another Physic Class. 10/10 recommend!

Dr. Gulley doesn't make this class harder than it needs to be. I'm not the best when it comes to physics, but I still got an A. We had 4 exams during the semester with a final at the end (extra credit surveys for tests), homework and breakout help better understand the concepts. Not an easy class but would def would recommend to take Dr. Gulley.

He's a good lab professor. He explains the topics well, he's a nice guy, and he's pretty good at getting stuff graded in a decent time period. He and the TA are helpful and do a good job in my opinion. Don't know what his lecture is like, but if he were an option, I would def take him.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Graded by few things--Caring

comment: During labs, Mr. Gulley and the TA were always there to help with confusion. At first, reading the instructions of labs were confusing to me, but Mr. Gulley always responds to emails and clears all confusion through them. He does the same in person as well. Ask questions and they will be answered! Great teacher with clear and concise labs!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Dr. Gulley is one of the best professors out there!!! I probably wouldn't have passed physics if it wasn't for him. He cares so much about his students and their success! He is super responsive to emails and will help you as much as possible. He literally made a PDF title with my name on it to answer all of my questions. 10/10. Love Jeremy!!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Prof. Gulley is one of the funniest, most thoughtful & caring professors I have ever had. He genuinely wants you to learn and know the material. Work hard and he will notice, even if your grades aren't the best. Even if I failed this class entirely I would still retake him. Awesome awesome guy!
Hes a fantastic professor with a good sense of humor, which makes the class easier to follow. Make sure to keep up with the homework! Hes always available for help on questions and is fair grader.

Dr Gulley is awesome! i took him for Phys 1 lab and i did not regret it at all! He doesn't give exams only labs. Once you are done taking data in the lab you can leave. There's only 11 labs and he drops the lowest graded lab. technically if you do well on 10 labs you get to sit out the last lab. HE IS AN EASY A FOR LAB!

This man is an absolute genius! I went in to this semester thinking the class would be a nightmare, but he makes it anything but that. Read the textbook before class so you can understand his lectures better, which are the most impressive I have ever seen. I was never confused with any of his responses to my questions. Physics will never be easier!
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures

comment: He's pretty funny which makes his lectures entertaining. Just do the homework, go to class , and do the practice tests. Make sure you know how to the each type of problem that is worked out in lecture. Although this is calculus based, there is only 1 calculus question per test and it's usually something simple like a derivative or an integral.

Can't be trusted. Said Final Exam would be 'easy' and 'medium' questions. Nope, 16 q's sums up the entire course, with most by far being difficult questions. He 'forgot' to supply students with constants, AND, forgot to include mass on a long problem. Said semester exams were the best study guide. Only ONE problem resembled any of the tests.

Gulley is a caring person but made his course much too difficult for it to truly be an introductory physics course. Expect homework! Gulley provides practice tests before each exam; however, beware that his practice tests are easier and often nothing like the ones given in class. There are very few who made an A in this course out of almost 50.

Gulley is awesome. Night and day difference from my phys 1 professor. I'm a borderline A right now and in phys 1 I barely had a C. His tests are very fair, and he gives previous years tests to study. One of the best ive had so far. Very smart guy, and hes willing to help and enjoys explaining things to you. Hes a very fair grader
rating_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Clear grading criteria--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: I was terrible at physics 1, but managed to pass with a C. I'm taking Gulley for PHYS 2 now and it's a night and day difference. He gives amazing lectures, and actually explains in detail what he's doing. His test wasn't too easy, but I don't expect to ever find an easy physics test. If you have to take PHYS 2, sign up with this guy.

Dr. Gulley is the best physics teacher I've ever had. His lectures are available online and it contains everything you need for his exams. He walks through problems step by step, and he allowed us to remediate exams for half our points back. Recitations are mandatory, but not on test weeks. I enjoy his class, and he has a very nice speaking voice.

2212. genuine, approachable, and an extraordinary instructor. Has sat with me a couple of times one on one and after recitation explaining concepts I was having difficulties with. PHYS II is much more challenging that 1 there's no getting around it. 4 tests then recitation 10% and HW is 20%. Test 1 material seemed to be most difficult so keep at it

I'll be real here. Gulley is the type who is very caring, and wants you to succeed. However, it seems as though his teaching style is meant more for a place like Tech or MIT, not Kennesaw State. He is practically a genius, and I feel as though he's better off teaching upper level physics courses. Amazing guy, but very difficult class.

Where do I even begin. Gulley is very nice, and a great professor, but it feels like he's speaking another language when he teaches. His tests are incredibly difficult, and the people who say that he's not that hard are either physics geniuses or the ones that are teacher's pets. I am warning you, take someone else. An A is pretty much impossible.

Best professor I have had so far with KSU. The way he teaches is amazing. He is helpful explains hard concepts very well and takes his time. The material isn't easy, so no it won't be an easy A course no physics 2 lecture really is. He is fair in terms of grading exams. I wish I could take him for all my courses. Overall an A+ professor.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Inspirational--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Such a nice guy, but VERY tough tests. He tries to be gracious with grading, but it doesn't help when you get a 50 on his test WITH THE CURVE!I wish I had taken someone else. Sure, I will thoroughly learn the material, but probably at the cost of failing his class. AVOID!!!

I have no clue how this guy is rated so high. I have him for physics 2, and he takes an already hard subject, and turns it into something that only someone who is naturally good at physics &  studies a lot can pass. He did some weird stuff to the grading system to make it easier to pass, but get ready to feel lost after week 1. Very nice guy though
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--TEST HEAVY

comment: I'm gonna get a lot of heat for saying this, but I honestly didn't really like Dr. Gulley. It's not that he's mean or anything, he just doesn't understand how much is too much in terms of test difficulty compared to what he shows during lecture. Don't get me wrong, he's a nice guy, but maybe he should only teach upper level physics classes.

LAB REVIEW HERE! He is probably the easiest lab grader ever at KSU. Take him for lab, but do not take him for lecture! He's incredibly difficult in lecture from what I've heard. Again, take him for lab, even if it's at 8 AM, but try not to take him for lecture. His lab lectures will sometimes go over your head, but that's okay because it's so easy.

I would only recommend taking him if you are a physics/engineering major. I'm a chemistry major, & I struggled SO much in this class. Dr. Gulley is very caring, but honestly way too hard for introductory physics. He answers your question with very complicated replies, & his test questions are sometimes too much. Again, great guy, but a bit too hard

Easiest lab grader I have ever encountered, but incredibly difficult in lecture. In lecture, he's the type who even if you get the right answer on a free response question on a test, he won't give you full points unless you show ALL of the work that he wants to see. He's such a caring guy, but he needs to tone down the difficult a bit.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--TEST HEAVY--Amazing lectures

comment: An absolutely brilliant professor, but SO hard!!! In our class of around 50, there were only about 4 A's at the end of the semester.  If you put in the work, YOU WILL PASS, but the chance of getting an A are VERY low. Such a caring and relatable guy, but such a hard class. His lecturing might go over your head a few times,so go to his office hours!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--TEST HEAVY--Amazing lectures

comment: Amazing professor but difficult class!

Had him for lecture. Great guy who wants you to succeed, but he really struggles with answering questions with simple and concise answers. Sometimes people would ask him a simple question about something he just said, & his reply would be a complicated mini speech. Tests are pretty hard, but he'll give you the max amount of points he can.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--TEST HEAVY--Caring

comment: Be warned! A majority of these reviews are for his lab, not lecture. His lecture is easy to pass with some effort, but quite hard to make an A in. He goes WAY IN DEPTH into the theory, which at times means he neglects numerical examples. He is literally one of the best professor I've ever had, but he needs to dumb it down at times.

Easiest lab grader ever, but HARD in lecture. His easy grading carries over into lecture, which is great. One of the greatest professors I've ever had, but I feel like he's limitied by being here. He deserves to be at a place like MIT. At times his lecturing went over our head, and some test questions were just too much. Such a caring guy though.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--TEST HEAVY

comment: I attended his course in NIT Goa India. He is really a great teacher and teaches nicely. His way of teaching is amazing and he helps all questions very confidently and correctly. Really a full of knowledge and i would never hesitate to say him a sea of nonlinear optics.

Dr Gulley is a wonderful professor. I had him for PHYS I lab, but he explained the lecture materials better than my lecturer. He was a good grader. He explain things thoroughly before the lab and can ask question while do the lab. I don't know about his tests on lecture.

(Took Phys 2211 Lab) This could be perhaps the greatest Physics professor of all time. I unfortunately only had the opportunity to have Lab with him, but when I had questions with lecture, I asked him, not my lecturer! He makes everything crystal clear, and by the way, Physics 1 lab is the easiest science lab at KSU. We played with cars and string.

Dr. Gulley is a great lab professor. He explains everything clearly and comes into every class enthusiastic. His grading is super easy. Answers all questions, and his excitement for physics is infectious.

Dr. Gulley is an excellent professor, so his classes fill up very quickly. He has taught for a while so he knows the best way to explain things to help students understand. He posts old exams so you know what kind of questions to expect on the exams. This doesn't mean they are easy at all, the final was extremely challenging.

He is good, but don't be fooled this class is not easy, well physics is not easy. you have to do a lot of problem solving to prepare for tests, they are mainly working probs. There are hardly in class examples which can prepare you. Final exam is DIFFICULT!!

Dr. Gulley is the best physics professor at KSU. He could teach and is very clear on what's expected. He is very fair. He's ALWAYS available in his office for help. GO. TO. HIS. OFFICE. Do ALL of your homework, and you will make an A. I repeat: DO YOUR HW. I figured that out after my first exam that I did really bad on. TAKE GULLEY!!!

Dr. Gulley is a brilliant and devoted teacher. He can explain things in a simple way, so he really understands the stuff he's teaching (according to Einstein's logic)! Taking his class was one of the best choices I've made in my life. He is also a really smart guy and you can ask him about anything. Highly, highly recommend!

Exceptional at explaining the concepts behind physics and helping students understand.  He is mostly concept based, so you might need his office hours for help.  Do the homework, it is the easiest way to not struggle.  Tests have "point redemption" that gives you points back if you can explain why a multiple choice answer is wrong.  Great teacher!
Wonderful professor!  VERY hard class.   Had him for 2211 also and wouldnâ€™t have wanted to take physics with anyone else.  Do the HW long before the tests and ask him lots of questions.

Dr. Gulley is a great professor, but he does not teach/lecture the class like the tests are set up. You learn about things in class and derivations of problems, but come to the test and it is all working problems. If you want to teach yourself how to solve physics problems for a test, take him. Otherwise take someone else.

difficult subject, but you can learn it from MIT's ocw online.  class is a waste of time, unless your preparing for a concept test, which your not.  majority of testing is on problem solving.  Gulley does little to no problem solving in class, just focuses on concepts... translation: take someone else if you dont want to have to teach yourself.

he born to teach physics. other professors envy him because he is real good at teaching although he's newbie. other prof might out smart him but they can't teach like he does. you wont find better physics prof in kennesaw
Great professor. He makes the class laugh. Helpful. Tests are pretty hard, kinda.. the final is harder. Read the txtbk, do the hw, ask him questions, and you'll do fine.

An excellent professor. Explains everything perfectly to where it all makes sense. Spends an hour teaching class and then spends lots more time with students helping homework. On the quizzes and tests, he wants to make sure you understand the material. The final is really hard though.

Great Professor. Physics doesn't come easily to me. He manages to explain them clearly and concisely in class while giving physical demonstrations. Do your reading and HW and you will have a very enjoyable time.

If Physics is the last class that you would optionally take, Dr. Gulley is whom you should take. His tests are not very easy but he is very helpful and he curves them by 20 points so you can make a 50 and still pass. Labs are confusing but he will help you and make it enjoyable. Also is very funny and tries to make the class interesting. TAKE HIM!
